description.narrative: An evaluation of UN Women is planned for 2017 as a part in the assessment for a probable assessment.
En utvärdering av UN Women i Afghanistan 2014-2016 planeras, för att kunna föda in till en beredning om stöd till UN Women i Afghanistan även från 2018 och framåt.

Utvärderingen gordes tillsammans med Norge och Finland i Afghanistan som en del i samarbetet kring UN Women och jämställdhet. Sida stod för hela finansieringen av utvärderingen. För Sida komresultaten av utvärderingen att föda in i den nya beredningen av det fortsatta stödet till UN Womens landprogram för 2018 och framåt. Det nya stödet inleddes med en Inception Phase, baserad på resultaten i utvärderingen och rekommendationerna. Insatsens mål: - Att hjälpa Sida, Norge och Finland, liksom UN Women att besöma framsteg i det nuvarande UN Women landsprogram i Afghanistan för att lära om vad som fungerat väl och mindre väl och för att informera hur programimplementeringen kan anpassas och förbättras - Förse Sida, Norge och Finland, liksom UN Women med en ingång till uppkommande diskussioner gällande förberedelser och framtids stöd till en ny programfas.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

description.narrative: UN Women's programme has been and remains broadly relevant to the context of Aghanistan, although the balance of priorities has been driven more by funding availability than by a strategic or long-term vision of what is needed to respond to this context. While there is some evidence of flexability in the implementation of the programme, what does seem to be lacking is the capacity to be able to effectively analyse the context, particularly in terms of society and governance, and to build this analysis into programme implementation. Main Recommendations: - A start is made by taking a more realistic and pragmatic view of what can be achieved in a difficult and insecure context and of what capacity (staff and finances) is needed to achieve this view - UN Women should back up the broad and relevant problem analysis with better political, governance and institutional analysis, focused on identifying where there is lekely to be the potential for significant changes that will affect gender inequality - This analysis should start with the development of a longer-term approach to working with civil society and the women's movement, looking at ways of sustainability developing civil society's roles. - UN Women should focus on ensuring continuity of leadership backed up with strong national capacity for implementation and monitoring - UN Women need to take a more strategic realistiv approach to what the organisation can deliver, with efforts that are focused more on building better relationships rather than being drawn into direct implementation or being a channel for funds - UN Women needs to take a much more comprehensive and cinsistent approach to monitoring and evaluation across all areas of the programme
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
